title: How would travel to Europe change after the new Brexit deal?
text:
The UK seems to have edged closer to leaving the EU after Prime Minister Boris Johnson agreed a deal with its leaders.

Though nothing is certain and there may likely be a further delay it is worth considering what it would mean for holidaymakers if we do leave by October 31?

With the deadline barely a week away there are still few indications of exactly what sort of disruption travellers might have to suffer.

Even if passport checks at arrivals halls are smoother than expected, there remain numerous elements of trips abroad that may change come November, including driving licence validity, health insurance and customs rules.

Here, we run through what this means for trips to and from Europe if the UK leaves the EU with a deal on October 31, and what could happen if we leave without a deal.
